meanings.definition: Biologics: substances made from living organisms
meanings.sent1: The biologics used in the experiment were extracted from plants.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying the effects of biologics on patients with chronic illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The biologics in the lab were so lively, they almost seemed to dance under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a treasure trove of biologics, each plant a tiny factory of life.
meanings.sent5: The biologics pulsated with vitality, a testament to the wonders of nature.

meanings.definition: Biologics: medications derived from biological sources
meanings.sent1: The pharmacy stocked a variety of biologics for different health conditions.
meanings.sent2: Patients are prescribed biologics to help manage their symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The biologics in the medicine cabinet whispered tales of their natural origins.
meanings.sent4: Her recovery was swift, thanks to the powerful biologics coursing through her veins.
meanings.sent5: The biologics were like tiny healers, working their magic within the body.

meanings.definition: Biologics: treatments that target specific molecules in the body
meanings.sent1: The new biologics aim to block the harmful molecules causing inflammation.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are excited about the potential of biologics in personalized medicine.
meanings.sent3: The biologics were like tiny detectives, seeking out the rogue molecules in the system.
meanings.sent4: Her body welcomed the biologics like long-lost friends, guiding them to their targets.
meanings.sent5: The biologics acted with precision, honing in on the exact molecules causing trouble.
